definition: water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes

sentences.english: the dripping saliva now, will become the tear of tomorrow .
sentences.chinese: 此刻流的涎水，將成爲明天的淚水。

sentences.english: She swallowed twice before she greeted her friend.
sentences.chinese: 在她向朋友打招呼之前，喉嚨裏吞了兩次涎水。

sentences.english: As if a stone lion shot out a fissured emerald bead covered with saliva.
sentences.chinese: 像石獅子吐出裂痕斑駁，沾滿涎水的翡翠色石珠。

sentences.english: You use your own saliva to clean your child's face.
sentences.chinese: 你可以用自己的涎水去擦孩子臉上的髒物。

definition: to let drip/to trickle down/to shed (tears)
bloody mouth wide open like a sacrificial bowl (idiom); ferocious mouth of beast of prey/fig. greedy exploiter/rapacious aggressor
bloody mouth (from devouring freshly killed prey)
to let saliva dribble from the mouth/to slobber
to overflow/transverse flow/to flow over/cross flow
